fullText: Kevin Spacey brings his considerable star power and magnetic stage presence to Shakespeare's deformed villain, but the production feels oddly muted and underpowered.
dtliExcerpt: Kevin Spacey brings his considerable star power and magnetic stage presence to Shakespeare's deformed villain, but the production feels oddly muted and underpowered.
bwwExcerpt: Limping around with his hump hidden under a cloak and a gammy, shriveled hand pinned uselessly across his chest, Rylanceâ€™s Richard deliberately flirts with caricature. He approaches the ruthless climber as an unlovable runt, crippled as much by bitterness as by his deformities. Playing shamelessly to the crowd with his halting speech and false air of self-pity, he makes the audience complicit in every vile deed that Richard executes or orchestrates. Only deep into the action after he has seized the crown does the pathos of his victims alert us to the blood on our hands.
showScoreExcerpt: Kevin Spacey brings his considerable star power and magnetic stage presence to Shakespeare's deformed villain, but the production feels oddly muted and underpowered.
